Description:
Ballistics of 100x695mmR 3UBM11 round with the 3BM25 "Izomer" APFSDS projectile, for use with the tank gun D-10. Although ballistically identical, the round is forbidden from use on BS-3 gun due to presence of muzzle device. The "Izomer" round was developed alongside "Zastup" (115mm), "Zakolka" (125mm), "Kalach" (100mm T-12) persuant to a directive issued in 1972, with production beginning in 1975-76 and adoption in 1977-79. Projectile is a sheathed penetrator with tungsten-carbide core.

Cartridge loads 5.9 kg of 12/7 V/A grains. Performance variation from АРТИЛЛЕРИЙСКИЕ МЕТАТЕЛЬНЫЕ ЗАРЯДЫ (Kazan, 2004) as follows.
T   P.mcp  V [copper crusher gauge]
°C  MPa    m/s
-40 241.33 1364
15  300.18 1430 
40  344.33 1466
Chambrage 1.62 from ФИЗИЧЕСКИЕ ОСНОВЫ: устройства и функционирования стрелково-пушечного, артиллерийского и ракетного оружия
